p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV), western, eastern and Venezuelan equine encephalitis virus (WEEV, EEEV, VEEV) and Sindbis virus (SINV) are the most prominent members of the Togaviridae family. CHIKV is transmitted by Aedes mosquitos and can cause symptoms such as fever, rash and joint and muscle pain [54]. VEEV is confined to Central and South America and can infect humans causing flu-like symptoms in healthy individuals, and severe illness and death in the immunosuppressed. This virus has been weaponised by the USA and the Soviet Union [55]. SINV has a wide geographic distribution and can cause fever, rash, polyarthritis and myalgia in humans [56].
